caption: It was a fun experience. The guides were really cheerful and the tour included a wonderful 3D video and another heart touching video. There was a scent room where we could smell the scents of sweets, spices and fruits. Many coca cola artifacts were displayed very aesthetically throughout the place.  The best was the unlimited tasting of different coca cola products. I think there were around 100 flavours around the world but unfortunately it was too much for me to taste on the same day. The experience was totally worth the money and I highly recommend you to visit World of Coca Cola at least once.

Fun experience.  Right next to the Georgia Aquarium.  A very fun walking tour.  It was like a museum walking tour or the history of Coca Cola.  Plenty of cool stuff to see.  Vintage ad signs, vending machines, signs, and so much more.  Take your time and read the walls in each exhibit, the history is really interesting.  The scent room was interesting.  The tasting room was fun.  Trying all the different Coca Cola products from around the world was very cool.  They even had Mezzo Mix, which I used to drink all the time when I lived in Germany.  The gift shop was amazing, so many cool things to buy.  Highly recommend if you have 2+ hours to kill in downtown Atlanta.

A memorable experience like no other! We were guided each step of the way by friendly, knowledgeable staff members. You get a better understanding of the history of Coca Cola, which is presented in an entertaining way! Definitely worth your time and money.

This was a fun experience. Tons of memorabilia! I recommend buying tickets in advance. We were greeted with a very enthusiastic staff and treated to a little trivia before the move. The movie is a short feel good film to get your emotions running before they tantalize all of your senses in the exhibits. The exhibits are mostly relics and information. There is some interactivity sprinkled in, but the most interactivity is in the aroma room and the fountain room. I also suggest to bring some tums with you. Tasting all the different sodas from all over the world was as bloating as it was delicious and fun. Gift shop actually had some sales.

Had an Amazing experience here. From the very beginning we were guided , provided with lots of background details about the origin and its worldwide influence. The scent discovery and tasting part was a real hit. You can discover a large variety of Coca Cola flavors there. Didn’t have an idea prior to this trip that these flavors of coca cola do exist. Enjoyed every moment inside the museum. You can get a lot of souvenir options. They keep some awesome collection of lip smackers.

We visited World of Coke early on a Sunday and it was a great way to spend a few hours with kids. Even as an adult, I found the history of Coke very interesting. They really do a good job of making engaging exhibits with real, human tour guides while selling Coke along the way.  The highlight, of course, is the tasting room. Although it's a little gross, it is cool to be able to taste different drinks from all over the world, which would otherwise be pretty difficult. The gift shop was also better than expected and had a wide variety of apparel and toys.  You are going to want to stop here. This is the main thing in Atlanta so be sure to not miss it!

It's good to see some of the interesting facts about the history of their products. Try to go afternoon/evening so there won't be much crowd and probably you could enjoy the Taste it! , a place where we can taste all of their products. As it's so close to the Aquarium and parking is common, it's better to plan together.

Had a wonderful time at the World of Coke! Only thing I would recommend is getting tickets in advance because it was extremely busy. Masks were required for right now. But once inside there is a vault that explains the history behind the beverage. A movie about coke and a 3D theater, a smell lab and a tasting room which was the best part! In the tasting room there were different areas to try coke from around the world! At the very end there is a gift shop. I thought this is definitely a place to check out in Atlanta, especially being the HQ for coke too.

The World of Coca-Cola was a great mid-morning adventure to learn a little history and taste flavors of soda from different places.  They have several exhibits with historical items which are fun to look at and they even have a smelling room for exploring different smells and recommend what you may like if you like it a particular one.  I enjoy looking at all the older marketing materials to see how things have transitioned over time and the tasting room is great too.

The world of Coca-Cola offers an inexpensive family friendly excursions delving into everything coca cola. Great place to pick up Cola themed souvenirs for friends and family. Admission also grants access to the drink station where visitors will get to sample cola products from around the world. Overall its a lot of fun and will help will your schedule while in town. Makes for a great follow up activity to the Georgia Aquarium since they're right next to each other.

My friends and I had a great time here! So fascinating to learn the history of Coca-Cola. We loved the interaction displays and taking a picture with the Coca-Cola bear. We loved the taste testing at the end. One of the best highlights of our Atlanta Trip! Recommend buying the City Pass if you plan to visit multiple Atlanta attractions during your stay. We saved a lot of money doing it that way.

A cool place to visit. Fanta being one of my favorite during school/college days, it was fascinating to visit this museum to learn the history of the Coca-Cola drinks. The sweet, fruity & spicy scents, the taste of all the varieties of drinks they have introduced around the world, the vault of the secret formula and the portrait walls, it was well worth the money spent!

If you're a fan of Coca-Cola, then the World of Coca-Cola is definitely worth a visit! They have a wide selection of different Coca-Cola products from all over the world, and the exhibition is really cool, with a smell room and a look at how they make and bottle Coke. It's usually a orientation, but this time it was self-guided, which was nice. Overall, it's a fun place to visit, especially if you're a fan of Coke!

Such an extensive, fun, interactive exhibit for all things Coca Cola brand. My personal favorite was the taste testing, and the smell exhibit. Looking at all the signs were fun, and they have a replica machine from their bottling plant. A little pricey for a museum. But the staff are so knowledgeable and friendly. It’s a fun experience. Outside on the grass between the aquarium and Coke world is a beautiful view of the skyline!

We spent 36, $18 for each of us. It was WELL worth it. All of the “super fans” tour guides were amazing. A lot of heartwarming content and they were so kind and inviting. After the toured part you get to explore by yourself, so many cool exhibits and stations. It feels very high tech! I would’ve easily paid a few dollars more. I did find the cost of the photos they take unreasonable to get printed especially since they’re not all that great. We skipped and took our own photos and I feel they came out more beautiful. We got to taste Coca Cola products from different countries, everything was so fun and family friendly.

Really neat place with a lot of cool Coke memorabilia. Goes through the whole history of how it was made and changed over the years. The end was great you are able to taste the different Coke products from all over the world. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable to make the visit and tour great.

Coca cola world, it's actually a museum where they show you a 6 min movie and post that you visit the vault where they share the facts and journey of coca Cola recipe. They have a section to try out on murals and scent of different flavors. After that we tried on over 100 kinds of coke from across the globe. They have a souvenir shop as well. One time visit is recommended. They have parking space on site charges 17 usd.

The entrance costs around $20. You can estimate to spend 4 hours in the place. There is parking across the street that costs $10 for 4 hours. The place has 2 floors. They arrived you in the first floor and a Coca Cola member will greet you and explained you how the tour works. The tour is “self - service”. You can choose where to go. But when you go out to the gift shop, you cannot go back. There are different rooms: a cinema with a movie about cocoa cola, some taste experience, some smell experience. You can take a pic with Coca Cola bear. He comes at 4 different hours to the lobby.

Loved this... It was so cool. The little video at the start really did pull on the heart strings lol We tasted so many flavors. Did not love them all but loved that we had the options. Its so fun to try things from places you may never get to visit. I think the smell room was my favorite. The man working the room was hilarious.

Nice place to spend a few hours. The most memorable thing about the visit was guessing the different ingredients in the scent discovery room. The tasting room is also fun, and I quickly realized that my original plan to try a small sip of every flavor was not possible after reaching station 3 of 4, so try the ones that intrigue you the most first. Enjoyed learning some tidbits and looking at so many artifacts. The museum is right next to the Georgia Aquarium, and we had enough time to do both in the same day.

This place is a MUST GO! It’s an experience you don’t want to miss.  Especially for my soda lovers.  If you enjoy learning and seeing pictures of the history of Coca Cola as well as seeing the original bottles from before.  This is definitely great for children or all ages. I have never drunk soda from so many different places around the world in just one spot.  There’s over 30+ flavors to try from different parts of the world.  The best of course is the original Coca Cola from the USA.  There’s a city pass that you can purchase in advance and save time and money! You get up to (5) five days to complete all the attractions for a week of family fun in Atlanta.

This experience was by far one to remember. The tour was very informative but in a fun, lively and hands on way. I loved the opportunity of getting to see some of what goes on as far as production as well as smelling the different flavors and guessing what it was. I also had the opportunity to do the tasting of all the flavors which was an up and down roller coaster but it was fun. We had a group of 4 which included one 8 year old and the rest adults. Granted when we arrived the line was long due to their system being down and we had to wait over an hour to get in but they did pass out water and made sure we were hydrated to the very least.

I had some time to kill while in Atlanta so I came to the world of coca cola. It was interesting. They have it very organized and orderly which I appreciated. I enjoyed the tasting room at the end where you can taste all of the coca cola products from around the world.

Good experience, but don't spend any money on fast track or skip the line tickets. They just tell you to go ahead as it is not too busy. And it is not. I like tasting the sodas around the world, though some of them were too sweet or bitter for me. Still great time.

It was a nice couple of hours walking around and seeing the vast history of Coca-Cola, it is very touristy and feels a little more like propaganda but it was still a nice time. There is a taste room, which was an obvious star of the attraction. You get to taste all the different flavors of what Coca-Cola manufacturers around the world. One of the guides said there is one that tastes like BBQ sauce and boy was he not wrong about that! Actually does 😂 its a good place to spend with kids, but if you are not coming with kids and just want to relax and enjoy, watch for the school field trips that frequent this place. We had probably 5 field trips happening while we were there- not the best time to be there with all the kids on high amounts of sugar running around.

This was such as awesome experience! What a really cool and refreshing place to enjoy spending about two hours around if you want to read and explore the story of the world's most popular beverage .The building consists of 3 floors.Also there is a gift shop .Tickets are $22 and the fun part was the 3rd floor tasting room. This room had many of the different beverages that Coca Cola makes from all over the world and you can try as much as you want and the exhibits were interactive, perfect for all ages . they require masks at all times except for the tasting room . I highly recommend this place if you want to learn the history and impact of a company/product that has been and is such a big part of our culture. We parked at the Aquarium park $12 (with tickets) $17 regular. There is a little parking lot in the corner that was $10. The weather was really nice and enjoyable to walk out and look at coca cola’s huge ornaments on the lawn.

To taste the different Coca-Cola beverages all over the world is the best experience in this place!  We tried hundreds of drinks and I can tell that the best coca-cola drinks are Minute Maid - Joy Apple Lychee (Korea), Fanta Melon Frosty (Thailand), Fanta Apple Kiwi (Thailand), Fuze Tea (Venezuela) and Royal Watermelo (Philippines).  Never try the Beverly drink from Italy.  You will not like it for sure. In addition, we enjoyed the different shows and stations of the museum.  To smell the aroma of the drinks are also a unique experience! It's an amazing experience overall, especially for kids 🤣

We were able to get in very quickly as I purchased tickets online. It was a little too crowded inside to take your time to read the history behind Coca Cola. I appreciate that they required masks and constantly reminded those who may not be wearing them appropriately or who may have removed them. We wanted to get a picture with the Polar Bear but opted not too as he looked like he needed to be cleaned and brushed. That was disappointing as I was looking forward to that part the most.

Good, fun place to stop to spend some time, learn something new and get to try some amazing sodas from around the world. The soda room at the end was my favorite and I'm happy they put the plastic dividers up to make it more COVID friendly. I haven't been for years and I guess they stopped giving away the glass coke bottles at the end of the tour which is sad/disappointing but I'm happy with what they do still offer. The one comment I'd say is to fix their coke bear because he looks a bit worn down + scary.

Had a great time! I love Coca-Cola and this has the history and the nostalgia of the brand. It's festive and informative as well as getting to taste every flavor they make from all around the world. They don't take cash but I don't think anyone does in Atlanta just FYI

What an awesome experience for a company that is recognized worldwide. The highlight is the drinks from all around the world. Some flavors were awesome fruit punch, orange and others were terrible like sour plum, green apple. But overall an amazing experience and at the end buying Coke fridge magnet was also pretty cool.

This place was extremely fun! I wish the tour guide in the beginning could’ve stayed through the entire thing. But overall I’m definitely coming back especially for the shop at the end. I recorded more videos than pictures. 😂

Honestly wasn’t a fan of this attraction when visiting ATL for Christmas! Having to enter in groups made it difficult to enjoy the sites of each room, it was too crowded. Staff yelled so much, had a massive headache by the end of the “vault” self tour. The man who was in charge of the line for the polar bear photos continuously shouted the same information repeatedly and it was so uncalled for. Maybe i wasn’t aware but i suggest escalators and/or elevators as an option to get to the next floor because the stairs aren’t convenient for elderly and handicap. Along with the staff yelling and shouting, guest were being rushed. It was such a hassle! A bummer they no longer give out glass coke bottles during your visit. Only part i enjoyed was the e gift shop, had a good handful of affordable gifts.  Overall, the aquarium is a better option. Absolutely loved it!  They encourage mask, not force you like we were by staff at World of coca cola.

Museum is great to visit for both children and adults. It shows you a full history of Coca-Cola company. It is huge so you definitely gonna spend here at least 2 hours. There are a lot of entertaining exhibits. You can even try different samples of beverages and by some gifts at the end of your museum tour.

Fantastic place with all the historical details of coca-cola. However, I am disappointed that they have stopped welcoming guests with a can of coke. As you enter, they have a quick guided tour. And then you can move on to all the guided tours. It can take you about an hour or so to finish walking the entire place Unless you want to take a picture with the white polar bear. There’s always a line for it. However, I think the polar bear is way too skinny. Before you leave the place, you can try out all the millions of sodas that the company produces. Amongst all the flavors, I like the lychee flavor. We have tried flavors that we didn’t find in the market. Overall it’s a fantastic place for any age.
Well worth the stop. Visited on New Years Eve and it took about 3 hours to tour. Nearly 100 different Coca-Cola global products to try at the end. Great experience and highly recommend.

We had a lot of fun here while we were in Atlanta. The tickets were about 20 per person and there were about 7 different rooms to see. The main floor was mainly what they called “artifacts” and the upper floor was interactive. Overall we had a really fun time and learned lots about coke!

Great place to take your children and is on the list of things to do in Atlanta. The City Pass is well worth the purchase and the high-spirited employees are always funny and inviting. The trading and smelling rooms will capture a bit of time. So much to see and do here related to Coca-Cola, it's history, and it's brands.

Was a great history lesson on Coca-Cola with a good bit to see.  The kids enjoyed the scent area where you guess different smells of ingredients used in different products.  Pace yourself when you get upstairs and start trying all the flavors.  There are so many.

A historic place. One of the iconic place,  landmarks of Atlanta. Located right in the most happening part of Downtown Atlanta. There is an entry ticket of around $19 per adult. One has to select a particular time slot. Entry is allowed in batches as there are guided assigned who will take over. There is a 3-D theatre here, a pop culture gallary, plenty of photography spots, Scent discovery outlet,  a coca cola merchandise store  and clean washrooms. The highlight of this place is the Taste it tasting room where one can try all the different types of coca cola beverages available in all the countries across the world. You can have as much as you want. All in all, it was an amazing experience. One must not miss visiting this place at any cost. Would surely recommend.

The birth of the world famous coca cola.!! My favorite was the tasting room . Experiencing the different flavors of coca cola from all around the world was truly a great experience.  Also enjoyed the smell room where we experienced the fruity spicy and honey flavors used in coca cola.  Taking a picture with the polar bear is a must as well!!  The other exhibits like the vault , bottle making machines are decent as well. Definitely a one time visit if you visit Atlanta

One of the must place to visit in Atlanta. It was an Amazing experience. The place is so clean and well maintained. They have many artifacts on display that shows evolution of coca cola. This place also has many photographic opportunities. The 3D show here is one of the best we have seen. It was spectacular. Finally sampling area that gives opportunity to taste various coca cola products from all over the world. Entry pass is available only thru online. Place worth a visit. The souvenir shop has many products at affordable rates. This place is just 10 minutes walk from Peachtree Marta station.

I had so much fun stopping here! I enjoyed getting to learn about the history of Coca Cola and my favorite part was getting to try all the different Coca Cola products available worldwide at the end. It was fun to try the different flavors in China, Russia, Germany, Thailand,, etc all while in the same place. The gift shop was nice too!

This is a good place for adults or kids that can read. If you have small kids there isn't anything for them here.  If you are going in the afternoon make sure you go to the second floor as soon as you can to take the photo with the polar bear. When we entered no one from the staff told us that the polar bear was only available for pictures until 4:30pm. That was a disappointment.  Check the photos here in Google maps before you go. If you don't find the pictures interesting, then it is very likely you won't like inside even if you are a major fan of Coca-Cola and drink it every day.

I enjoyed the experience here. Loved learning about the history of Coca Cola, the company’s evolution, and the different drinks they make. Tasting the different drinks from around the world was my favorite part. I recommend this experience to anyone interested in branding, marketing, and business in general. Inspiring business story in my opinion.

Our visit was 16 Sep 2021 in the afternoon, there was three of us.  We really enjoyed the history and this museum.  We enjoyed the taste testing, nose testing and all the beautiful experiences Coca Cola offered.  We all brought items from the store.  My sister and I are huge Coke fans, hey I’m from Philly.  We are always having a Coke and a smile.  Place was very clean and kept up.  The staff was very professional and pleasant.  I hope to get some of my family members down and the ones that lived in GA have not been yet.  I would like to make it one day down during the holidays with all the lights.  There are plenty of parking garages or lots.  The aquarium is right across from Coke.  This was the last day of our business trip before flying and I will be back.

Visited here on a whim and with very low expectations, but was pleasantly surprised by how much effort was put into all the exhibits. This history of Coca-Cola was really interesting to follow and seeing old memorabilia was pretty cool. Our favorite part of the experience was trying all the soda samples from different parts of the world. It was pretty cool to taste the differences in flavor vs location! One small warning, beware of Beverly from Italy 😅

Parking is available within a 10 minutes walk..! Tickets can buy at the counter also. It took 40-50 minutes to explore inside. We tasted more than 50 plus flavors. Definitely one of the best place to visit once.

I don’t really drink coca cola, but I LOVE this museum. It’s so well designed and gives you an unforgettable experience.  You get to smell different ingredients in different coca cola products and taste all the different flavours around the world.  Totally enjoyed my tour and recommend anyone to go if you get a chance.

I loved exploring the history of Coca Cola. The workers are so cheerful and make the tour interesting. My favorite part was the taste it. Some of the coca colas were unbearable (I.e Uganda and Beverly) but some of them were really good.

This is my second time visiting. My first time was when I was in middle school. I took my little sister and cousin and enjoyed it just the same as an adult.  The scent room wasn’t open but will open back up in March. The staff are very friendly and express the spirit of coca-cola. The door ambassador that started the journey kept us engaged and excited about our experience.  There was a lot of people there as it was MLK weekend when we took our visit. The taste it room is fun. The videos are full of adventure and does a good job at drawing you in to the experience. It was nice to get refreshed on the experience of coca-cola. I highly recommend experiencing this place and the Georgia Aquarium on the same day. They are located right beside each other.  Make sure you are thirty when you go so that you can taste as many flavors as possible of coca-cola products. There is a lot of history to learn during this tour and experience. You can buy your tickets there. We didn’t wait it line long to purchase tickets.

I mean, it's everything you'd expect from the Coca Cola museum. The movie was pretty cool, and then the sensory experience were definitely most worth it. The other rooms were also fun, where they explain the history and some of the ways with which it influenced pop culture. So much sugar though at the end!

Absolutely amazing experience! I loved every second of it. For those in the know, im so happy I got to try Beverly. Now don't get me wrong, it was bad, but not nearly as bad as I thought considering it's considered the worst drink in the world. Lol.  That being said, the entire time I was there I had a smile on my face and it's so cool to see and learn about the history of Coca-Cola. Would totally recommend it!

Super fun place specially with kids. Taste colas from around the world - about 100 flavors. Learn all about the art and science of cola making and the history of Coca cola, the drink that changed the beverage industry!
Had a real fun time there. The best part was we got to try over 40 different drinks from all over the world. It's definitely worth visiting.

This is a good tour for a soda enthusiast or someone with an interest in old coca-cola memorabilia. They cram as many people as possible into each tour. This makes for navigating the area and information painful. You are able to view at your own pace, but it's too crowded.  Tasting about 30 sodas was fun, though.

Did a private tour with Kristin today. Loved it!! Our  group of 7 plus 5 other people. Kristin was so cheerful and funny. From start to finish it was an entertaining experience. Definitely worth the extra money to pay for the private experience.

We visited the World of Coca-Cola pre-covid. It was quite the experience. I would say there is something for everybody there. My favorite thing was the tasting of different Coca-Cola products from various countries. I easily spent a half hour in this section of the museum. The gift shop had plenty of different items to browse through. If visiting Atlanta, I highly recommend seeing the world of Coca-Cola.

Very recommended place to come!  Everything is great, the venue is not big, but each one is exquisite.  For history and its legends, this is definitely a place worth exploring!  There is also an amazing tasting center where you can taste a lot of different novelty flavors of coke, it's amazing!
Here you can see the history of Coca-Cola, rare items and event shows.  It is very spacious and can be enjoyed for a long time.  Especially the Halloween show during Halloween was good.🎃 …

$21 to watch some heart felt presentation that’s totally not staged to any degree by Coca-Cola. The museum part is interesting, but the best part of this place is that testing room. Groups tend to crowd around each station (and there’s 3 per station), so expect to stand there awkwardly waiting for them as they block the whole thing.  There are lots of flavors from different countries and at corner but just has current coke products. If you’ve been to EPCOT in Disney World, you’ll see many familiar products.  Gift shop is cute as always, but to justify spending $21 to drink some weird cokes and then to spend more money in the bookstore is kinda hard, especially since you have to listen to actors and a presentation for the first 20 minutes (can’t skip).  Wouldn’t recommend and I do wish that people could just access the gift shop without going through the whole thing (guard outside the exit of the shop were directing people to the front).

The 3D theater, all the artifacts, the smell room, and of course the taste room at the end all made for an enjoyable 4 hours. My 4 your old enjoyed every part and especially loved sipping various drinks from around the world. It was well worth the time and price.

Took the family to the World of Coke. Great visit and it was really cool seeing the history and how bottling works. Coke is a massive marketing company that sells beverages on the side. The first two exhibits seemed like we were rushed through. Overall it was a good experience. If you are in Atlanta stop in and check it out.

I went the first time like 7 years ago. Before covid this place was great, but I guess Covid took a lot from here too. But now everything “looks like” back to normal: no mask required , lots and lots of ppl all around you, means… this place is 100% back, so… why they can’t offer the same thing you were offering from before covid? 🤔  First, tickets still fair for a museum, adults:$19. Kids: $15, seniors: $17.  They used to have open coke bar before you enter the first attraction of the museum, Now they don’t. The 3D movie used to be 4D! (Was really, really cool) sadly they have to stop it because of a faulty seat malfunctioning several years ago. So no more moving chairs, sprinkling waters, snow falling, and tingling in your legs😞. Part of the museum was not showing anything at all(bottling part).  And they used to give you a 8onz glass bottle of coke for souvenir, (because of covid) they said. No more of those either. But… -you can buy one in the gift shop…they said🤣  Now… if is your first time going this place still cool to see it, tasting all over the world cokes and get ready to get your kids hyped 😅.

What an amazing weekend trip to Atlanta with my girls for a surprise girls weekend.   My 10&11 year old and I spent hours at Coca Cola world enjoying the history, interactives and tasting room.  The price for the experiences were well worth it. Excellent chance to learn history about our favorite beverage. We will go back again!

It was a fun experience learning the history of Coca Cola. The worldwide branding. The smelling and tasting rooms were our favorites.  The Olympic torches were cool and pics with the polar bear mascot

Surely worth a visit, The thicket is 20$ for adults,  less for kids and seniors, but there is also tax to add a bit more. Inside is beautiful and well organized. There are a few staff members who can help if you need anything. There is a sip/test area that is very enjoyable,  especially for kids. Tons of different Coca-Cola products from everywhere are available to taste. The end is a soviniour store and shop, of course overpriced,  but plenty of choices are there to shop. You need to park inside one of the nearby parking garages, not that much far, with less than 20$ for almost half a day. There is another parking area close by, not part of the facility,  a bit farther across the street,  but much cheaper, though.

A magnificent place. A lot to see and learn about the history of coca cola. Really loved it. At the end, you get to try as much coca cola as you want. So, it was like an all you can drink coca cola buffet.

This was my second time visiting the World of Coca-cola! It is a fun activity to do with plenty of history and memorabilia to view. The tasting area is fun and you get to try more soda than you'd ever wish to drink. I'd totally recommend pairing up going here and the aquarium in the same day!

Best place to taste coco cola brands all over the world. You should really go after having pizza at aquarium and enjoy different cola here.. amazing experience. Weekdays not crowded. Nice place . Typical 2 hrs

Choose the flat fee parking next to the World of Coke. The “quad” between the World of Coke and the Aquariums is lovely, the WoC has three shows that you must stand/sit through before self-touring the exhibitions, but the performers are excellent and the shows do not take too long. Plenty of opportunities for photos, if you have young kids their main focus will be the taste section and gift shop at the very end of the tour. The exhibitions are a lot of fun, but more appreciated by those who can read. If your kids cannot follow a regular museum tour, they may not get 100% from WoC.

The place was way overcrowded! Restrooms were disgusting, floor at the testing area was sticky and the 3D show is the old school kind that hurts your eyes. The stuff where annoying, it seems like due to poor training they where doing their own thing which was mostly disrespectful to the visitors. I think that this is not what the author intended. Parking is $17 flat fee. The biggest plus is that they have EV charging station.

If you like coke this is the place to learn everything about it! Many exhibits and things to do. We’ll worth the price. I would get my tickets ahead online. When I left the line to buy tickets was pretty long on a Saturday midday. The tasting room was my fav!

Coca-Cola museum... That's exactly what I expected, and it was so fun even though there is no new surprising stuff. It's just sugar water but you will realize it could be more than that. You can taste a lot of beverages there but the activity is going to be an activity that makes you recognize how the original Coca-Cola is special. That's my 5 cents!

This place was neat. A lot of coca cola artifacts from back in the day. Cool designs of packaging and you could see the line when it's produced. Not sure if it's real or just a demo for visitors. In the end you got to taste different come products from around the world (including tea, fanta, other products). It was unlimited. Gift shop was really cute too but of course pricey. It's nice if you combine your visit with aquarium and just park in the georgia aquarium garage. Also the Olympic park and the college football hall of fame (we didn't go). If you want. Stop by the yard milkshake bar. Not far of a walk while you're parked there. Otherwise parking would be a nightmare.

Tickets are about 19.00 I walked right up to the ticketing window. Nice holiday theme. Totally worth it,  very informative and the tasting at the end is really good. They have a new smell exhibit that I enjoyed alot.
It’s kinda fun if you are coco cola fan. Lot of good location for photos and you can get yo experience more than 100 different flavors
It's an amusing attraction and fun to see all the artifacts. The tasting room is like Epcot, where you can try lots of different flavors.
One of big famous world company. All coca cola history and items see. Also move was good family happy with coca cola good memories. All family recommend.

I have visited this place twice. Amazing fun experience with knowledge of history of Cola. As a pharmacist I was always intrigued by its inception. Polar bear pictures, scent museum, tasting room of all colas from world and 3D theater are highly recommended.
Pretty cool if u are a Coca Cola fan. The best part of the visit was the tasting station,  you get to taste all the Coca-Cola products throughout the world.
Enjoyed visiting world of coca cola, main attraction at this place os tasting different brands of coke in the world, you get to drink differet coke flavours . Overall good experience.

It was awesome. I had no idea the impact Coca-Cola has had in the world. It was amazing to see the old advertiment and packaging. There is a whole history in the museum. Even if you don’t drink it (I don’t) I recommend visiting the museum.  There is discounts for tickets so be sure to check if you qualify for any of them before purchasing. If you are visiting during busy Atlanta days I recommend buying the tickets ahead of time.

We had so much fun here at world of Coca-Cola. I couldn’t believe we were in there almost 3 hours, time went by flying but because we were enjoying our time. There’s so much to see and experience. I highly recommend this unique experience.

A wonderful experience and peak into the rich history of Coca Cola! You are also able to taste a variety of Coca Cola products from around the world. You can buy advance tickets online which makes it a bit easier to get in. Luckily when we went there was not much of a line, however the online experience is pretty seamless as well!

Very interesting and fun for all ages. The staff was spectacular,  full of friendly smiles and helpful energy. Can't wait to go back again. So much to learn, and I'm sure I didn't get it all.  Halloween 🎃 exhibit was very cute!

If your idea of fun is getting to try coke products that you’ve never heard of from around the world, this is the place for you.  Across a shared garden with the Georgia Aquarium and the Center for Civil and Human Rights, the World of Coca-Cola presents a fun history of the world's best secret recipe (which is kept in a vault at the museum). Interactive displays, scent challenge, taste testing, nice souvenir shop and enthusiastic hosts.  The World of Coca-Cola on Baker Street in Atlanta is a cool place to visit and learn about all things Coca-Cola. I really like all of the history and different items that they have on display here. The museum has a nice design and architecture. The staff here is very friendly and knowledgeable. My favorite part is being able to sample the different types of cokes from around the world. This place is fun and worth checking out.

Lots of fun and interactive exhibits- my favorite being the tasting room. There is also a smelling room, a movie theater, a history display, and more. It is a popular place, therefore a lot of my time was spent waiting outside of the exhibits, and the tasting room was not well regulated for crowds. Regardless, the staff were very nice and helped in the ways they could.

Had a really good time at the world of coca cola.  The history behind the drink is intriguing and the building is fun.  Love the artifacts and the tasting room and the movie theater along with the 3d film was quite enjoyable.  Beware your belly will be filled with coke products in the end.

One of the most touristy things to do in atlanta is to visit the world of cococola, that doesn't mean it's bad ,it's just over hyped and crowded. You got to try over 100 plus varieties of cococola drinks from around the world and learn about the history of cococola.
Amazing experience! I would definitely swing by again many times as I can. Even if it’s not a cheap entertainment place. Love it !
Fun to visit this place ! Good and nice experience of visiting this place to know the history of the fest drink !! Just 1-2 hours is enough ! Plan this visit with the aquarium ! Kids friendly place !
Great time and great guides as well. They had a taste center for different soda around the world. And a smell room and all the history you could want about the company.
Place was fun way to spend an afternoon. Entrance was 20 dolars and the best part is for sure the beverage testing in the end.

Took a look around the place and really enjoy the history of coke and seeing the vault and the scent room.  However was kind of sad when I found out I could not buy the different kind of coke that I just sample and bring some home.  Would of like to brought some home to my parents who no longer travel that much.  Also seen like they were a little pricey on the souvenir items.

Writing by @Driven_Estates: Where have I been? Well today I decided to take my family to the world of coca-cola! @worldofcocacola Our experience was absolutely amazing! The most rememberable moments was the Smell test, and taste test! If you plan on moving to or visiting Atlanta Georgia, you absolutely have to visit the World Of Coca-Cola. It's best if you purchase your tickets online. The Parking Garage Address is: 126 Ivan Allen Jr. Blvd NW Atlanta, GA 30313. Definitely a five star attraction ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

Upon entering I received a can of Coca Cola of my choice. After that, I entered a room where a movie played and I was greeted by an employee who was extremely kind and funny. We were guided through and area where the “secret recipe” is supposedly stored. After this, we watched a 3D movie about Coca Cola which was truly interesting. One of my favourite parts was the tasting room. This room had many of the different beverages that Coca Cola make from all over the world. Another interesting part of the museum was the history room. This room had many items and videos about the history of Coca Cola. After we visited the room that showed how it is is produced, we left through the gift shop which had many interesting gifts. Overall a great experience for only 14 dollars!

Not enough Diet Coke stories or testers or merch. Why are they trying to cover up Diet Coke’s existence when it’s their greatest product? When it’s the world’s greatest product?  The tasting room is fun, despite the lack of Diet Cokes from around the world. (Even Coke Light should be featured, but don’t get me started on that garbage Coke Zero nonsense.)

Just a wonderful experience overall.   So much history if you take your time and watch/read everything.  The tasting room is great.  Always fun things to try in there.  The international flavors are all... Interesting.

Worth visiting. The theme is the secret of the Coca Cola receipt, which is very well exhibited. Disappointed about the Taste it! Part which should be a highlight. There are only three different kind of stations each with 8 flavors, and the 100+ flavors is provided by the machine that you can easily find at fast food restaurant.
